{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3476326,"name":"Josh","username":"Joshanson527","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joshanson527/{size}/242531_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-09T04:18:13.910Z","cooked":"

Our team has 2 of the new VH-109 robot radios, and are setting them up as per the instructions for practicing at home. Another team member flashed the VH-113 firmware to the radio, using the steps linked. He didnâ€™t read the documentation saying you need a managed ethernet switch, and now we canâ€™t access the radio. We donâ€™t have a managed switch and Iâ€™ve tried everything (Network adapter VLAN ID, all the IP addresses, etc.) The 6Ghz light is on but I canâ€™t find a network, and canâ€™t connect via any ip or radio.local over ethernet!

Does anyone know anything about how to access the radio and flash the correct firmware?

Edit: I think I need to change the computerâ€™s ip to 10.0.100.5 but donâ€™t know what to put for the subnet prefix length.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-01-09T14:13:02.046Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":25,"reads":145,"readers_count":144,"score":154.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":480361,"topic_slug":"help-with-new-robot-radio","display_username":"Josh","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70836,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/help-with-new-robot-radio/480361/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3476347,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-09T04:27:25.302Z","cooked":"

connect to the radio over ethernet to the DS port, and make sure your wired network connection is DHCP.

Open a command line and after a min. or so type <arp -a> [at least on a windows machine] and hit ENTER.

Should give you a list of network adapters and the IP addresses they have seen recently on the networks they are linked too.

This may give you the 10. IP address the radio is at that you may not have tried to get to a config. page.

Edit: I accidentally programmed the PRACTICE AP firmware once and was able to revert using the firmware upload button on the config page - hopefully its that simple for you.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-01-09T04:34:36.213Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":140,"readers_count":139,"score":43.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":480361,"topic_slug":"help-with-new-robot-radio","display_username":"Joseph Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/help-with-new-robot-radio/480361/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3476359,"name":"Calvin Hou","username":"clavin","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/clavin/{size}/211896_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-09T04:40:29.888Z","cooked":"

If you are only doing at home practice with one robot, not at a practice field, the VH-113 is not necessary. Instead you can use the VH-109 firmware in Access Point mode, without a network swtich. Just make sure to flash the same SSID and password and they should automatically connect when they re both turned on.

Have you tried opening 192.168.69.1 or 10.0.100.2?
To open the VH-109 (configured as VH-113) configuration page

When I pinged 10.0.100.2 it said there was a response from some other ip, that had a subnet of 69 and was something like 192.124.69.19.
